text: This has the feel of a diner and it's exceptionally huge. There was an issue w my order and they handled it perfectly. We're visiting from Denver and we will go back to Perks for breakfast.
french toast was good and the scramble was good but overall it was good but nothing to tweet about, wait staff was friendly but get here early it gets packed
Super friendly owners, fast service and delicious food.  Try the Chicken on the Coup!

I have traveled all over the US with my service dog by my side and never have I ever been so offended.  The manager was just downright rude to me and I had no choice but to leave.  I would never go back or give them any support and neither should anyone reading this.

My hubby LOVES this place!  We just moved into the area and were looking for a close breakfast place.  The food it good (not 100% to my liking but that's just my taste buds).  The staff is very friendly and they have a few tables outside for when the weather is nice.  Inside is a large, high-ceiling one-room restaurant.  It's clean and consistent.  Again, don't let my taste buds defer you from trying this place out.
The owners, food and service are always fabulous!  Very reasonable prices. Great ingredients. Great atmosphere.
The food here is amazing and the service is very friendly.  A bit tucked away in a strip mall,  but well worth seeking it out.

It seems to me that that people rating this place have never been to a hole in the wall beakfast joint! There is SO much hype behind this place that, for me(&probably the food network), it was a disappointment.  NOTHING about the taste of their food stood out to me. Their pricing is outrageous! $4.79 for 2 pieces of sourdough toast?! I have been to a handful of breakfast establishments with better seating, more room, less wait times, better customer service, as good of tasting food and much better pricing.   I still have a headache trying to figure out the hype behind this place.
The food is good, the service is great and the place is inviting!

Second Triple D spot on this trip and the second breakfast at Perk. Had an awesome Sonoma omelet both days and my wife had the waffles which were just as good. Fast friendly service and very reasonable prices, next trip out we will be back to Perk.

Great fast service here! My coworker and I stopped in here for our lunch hour and were happily surprised to be seated immediately. We explained to our server Barry that we had limited time and had to get back to work, put in our order, and before we could get to deep in conversation, our food had already arrived. Barry was friendly and was even great about getting us our check right away so that we could get back to work on time.  Would definitely recommend.

I found this place to be pretty meh.  Food: I ordered badly and that shouldn't reflect on the restaurant. (I ordered french toast with brie and I dislike brie) But I had everyone else at the table try my dish, and all agreed that the brie in the toast was a cold lump, unsweetened, and just generally bad. Everything else was pretty good. Breakfast enchiladas were excellent.  Atmosphere: Like a more expensive Einstein's or Panera. Very busy, not great service.   Overall, not a bad place, but there are better places for breakfast.

My husband and i are always searching for great breakfast spots. These guys have the best pancakes in town, light and fluffy. Can't help but rave about their rosemary potatoes and their very tasty cilantro jalepeno sauce.My husband , the egg lover , has raved everytime he has ordered   something different on their menu.Especially like that their food is made with natural ingredients.  Service is very attentive

Saw this place DDD and happened to be in the area so gave it a try and man was it Really, Really Good! I had the Wine Country French Toast and the Chicken on the Coupe and what awesome flavor's! Definitely homemade and not from a can. Highly recommended people to check it out. I will for eat here again there so much more I want to try. Also the wait staff was superbly friendly.

Long overdue writing a review of my favorite local breakfast place!  Ingredients are fresh and menu is pretty diverse.  Big fan of the Lozoya sandwich for lunch and the Carmelized banana pancakes for breakfast!    Good to see them getting recognition from Phoenix Mag and the Food Network
Really good food and the service is great. I normally have the breakfast enchiladas which is my favorite dish here.

One of my favorite restaurants in the past, just went with my family for the first time.   Was told after I received my order and had asked for something else "that I had ordered that". Waiter walks away. Charged for it and nothing was address.   Such an embarrassing situation I will never be going back.

You know, we have supported this place from day one.  We have gone there when NO ONE went there.  We actually didn't think it would stay open, so we kept going hoping it would make it.  Well, we actually went there this past weekend after having very mediocre service and food for the past couple of visits.  It was packed and the place appeared still be doing great.  When our food came it was good but our 8 year old dropped his toast.  We asked if he could get another piece and the waiter said "sure".  Well, when the owner saw this she refused.  She wouldn't even allow the waiter to get him a single piece of bread without paying for a full order or toast.  The waiter was even stunned she was so rude about it.  ???  Are you kidding me?  When my wife asked her why she couldn't just let the waiter get a single piece of toast, she just blew off my wife.  We just spent $60 for breakfast and she couldn't get our kid a single piece of bread without paying for a full order.    I think the egos of these owners are getting out of control. We have 2 other friends who have had similar experiences with different issues.  Too bad that success has driven such arrogance.  We won't be back...ever.

We happened upon this place last spring when we were in Arizona for business and boy are we glad we did!  The interior is adorable and very diner-esque.  The french toast is divine. Scrambled eggs with brie and spinach sounds gross but tastes great.  I can't remember now what else we had but it was one of our more memorable breakfast meals in that week.

We had the waffles, and they were delicious with the caramel banana topping! We also had the potato pancakes, and they were decent. I wish they were a little more crispy.  Our waitress split the bill before we even had to ask, which was nice. But she never asked if we wanted to order anything more. We were a bit hungry and were thinking of ordering more.  They need more vegetarian lunch options.  All in all, it was pretty good. We might return if we are in the mood for brunch with friends.

I was in town on business and as usual searching for a new place for breakfast.  I get to the area often and always looking for something different.  I pulled up about 11 AM to this place at the end of a strip center. They weren't very busy, only a few tables. Upon arrival I was promptly greeted and shown to a table. It basically looked like a diner on one side but they had a bar on the other.  Why they have a bar when they are closed after 3 PM is beyond me.  I had their version of Huevos Rancheros.  A little different as they served me a quesadilla made with a corn tortilla and it was stuffed with chorizo, black beans, and cheddar cheese.  The eggs were placed on top and then smothered with what was described as jalapeño salsa. It was served with a hefty portion of Rosemary potatoes. Service was great but they weren't busy either.  Food appeared freshly made and served as ordered. I was graciously thanked on my way out.  I've had better, but everything was solid. I'll be back!

Had breakfast here and it was great   1. Big plates of food  2. Fair prices  3. Good service   We had breakfast and got seated quickly, food was good for the price. It was a nice for a breakfast spot and the Mediterranean omelet was ok. Pancakes were tasty.
This is the best place to go if you really want a tasty,healthy and affordable breakfast...their fresh ingredients are the best...the CILANTRO JALAPENO SAUCE is the BOMB...this is PERKFect place....

This is the best place to get breakfast (and they have good lunch items!). Very simple menu with delicious items! My family and I go here at least once a week. The owners always great us with a smile and a handshake. The workers are friendly and service is always excellent. Definite recommendation!

Very good breakfast. Small wait time on a Saturday morning but worth the wait, nice atmosphere and friendly service. Would certainly go there again when in the area good portions a little on the high price side.

We have been coming on and off for the last few years. You are greeted promptly and the wait time for a table depending upon the day of the week varies but usually no longer than 10-15 minutes on a busy day.   Food quality and taste is consistent. If you like brie and wine, the one item on the menu to try is the "wine country french toast". Of course, many of the items on the menu are worth trying as well. Oh, yeah, good size crispy bacon too for all you bacon lovers out there.   The staff are courteous and you never really have to ask for refills or chase someone. It's like they are reading your mind.  So if you are looking for something out of the ordinary than your typical burger and breakfast joint, you may be pleasantly surprised after your visit.   Bon appetit!

This place is amazing. Always fresh and great food with tremendous service. Everyone makes you feel like you are a valued customer. I try to make this my breakfast spot a couple times per month. The only thing that prevents this place from getting 5 stars is that they dont take American Express. Come on! In Scottsdale, AZ? You don't take the world's most prestigious card?
I've come here multiple times for breakfast and am never disappointed by the food! The breakfast potatoes are cooked perfectly and the omelets are full of flavor! Will definitely continue to go.

Food was outstanding! Saw this on the diners drive ins show so of course I had to try it.  We had the pumpkin walnut pancakes, the red wine French toast and the western omelet.  All of it was delicious! I especially loved the pancakes.  The service was awesome the owner came out and chatted with us and was so friendly.  Our server as well was very knowledgable and gave great service.  It's definitely a place to check out!
Great food.  All three of us enjoyed our meals.  Wasn't healthy but was delicious!

I've been coming here for years, mostly because it is not crowded and noisy like the other breakfast places. Today, I am sure will be my last.  The food is fine..nothing special but the service was very lacking.  To begin with it is your basic breakfast/lunch menu but the prices are quite a bit high for what is given.  When our bill came I was outraged to see upcharges on almost everything.  I guess you eat exactly what states on the menu because to add or remove anything plus any condiments are extra.  We were charged quite a bit more without being informed that there would be extra fees for any of it.  When I inquired with the manager, she began to argue with me that the computer does not have a button for removing cheese from an omelette, etc.  Therefore, that is where the extra charges came from and it is not policy to have the waitress inform the customer of the fees. Well, lucky for me there are plenty of places in the valley that serve breakfast :)

Came on a Saturday morning and sat at the bar counter to watch football on the one TV there. My Bloody Mary was good but not overly impressive. The outlaw scramble was delicious, and I really like the jalapeño cilantro salsa topping. Service was good, and the atmosphere was nice and calm. I'll be back to try some other menu items.

My first time here was okay. Waited an hour for my food because they had a glitch in their computer system. It was unfortunate because I had to sit there watching everyone that came in after me eat their meals. I ordered the corn beef hash it was good but way too many potatoes! 3/4 of my plate was all potatoes.. I call that potato overload!!

Staying over the The Westin Villas and looking for a non-hotel place for breakfast.  My fellow yelpers never let me down!  Perk was about a 2 minute drive (really, we should have walked), located in a strip mall.  It's a little place, but we were seated right away.  There appeared to be lots of locals milling about.  Ordered the banana, caramel walnut pancakes, and the hubby ordered the same by in the waffle.  Felt almost guilty as it was like eating dessert for breakfast.  Totally hit the spot!  I rarely give a 5 star review but consider this one a 4 1/2.  Would return again if ever in the area.
Very good breakfast. Busy but didn't take long for table. Excellent corn beef hash!

Just stopped in for Father's Day breakfast only to find the prices jacked up 20% and a limited menu.  Needless to say we walked out. We are locals and don't appreciate being taken advantage of. #greed
Great addition to area - which is missing good breakfast options. The brie, turkey, fig, egg combination was yummy and the Pete's steak sandwich was definately worth a return trip...

My husband and I went on a Saturday morning.   It took our server 30 minutes to acknowledge us.  It continued to go downhill. My husband ordered a tortilla and they brought him white toast.  I ordered rye toast and was brought wheat.  We ordered a pumpkin pancake on the side and brought a regular one.  We finished our meal and about 10 minutes later the pumpkin pancake appeared.  The rest of the food we ordered was good, but how do you mess up eggs and bacon? No apology, nothing was said!  Finally, our bill came and we were overcharged for the pancake.  The service was terrible!!

Waiters are very personable and take the time to make sure all your needs are meet. By the time you are ready to leave, they charmed their way to a 20% tip. Food is pricey considering the quantity but you pay for the service and a well thought out, simple menu.

This place has been a favorite breakfast stop for the wifey and I for sometime now. Quality and consistency are the two words that come to mind when describing The Perk.  You really can't go wrong ordering anything off the menu...pancakes are fantastic, omeletes are outstanding, breakfast potatoes, their toast, organic coffee, etc...all several notices above typical breakfast fare.  Service has always been solid as well. You can tell the owners take a lot of pride in what they do by their attention to detail - can't recommend highly enough.

Thanks to Yelp, we found this gem of a breakfast spot.  l had the Fancy Pants scramble with spinach, onion, garlic, turkey, brie, and fig compote and it was decadently delicious. My daughter had the breakfast burrito and the menu allows you to pick what you want inside which is great for youngsters. Other daughter had silver dollar pancakes and rediscovered her love of bacon at the same time. Will be back for sure.

Excellent breakfast!  This place actually serves a big omelet.  Why is it so hard to find a big omelet??  These places that specialize in breakfast, and give you a tiny, flat, skimpy omelet??  Why??  Anyways, I digress...  The eggs are perfectly cooked... and generous, very good rosemary potatoes, and great coffee.  Excellent, excellent service!  Fair prices.  Very clean!!  A gem for breakfast!

I ate at Perk this morning with my Husband and my Father.  Safe to say we each gave our breakfasts a 5 star rating. Service is always awesome when I go, as it is always nice to see the same smiling faces every time I go in. I had the special of the day which happened to be the bacon breakfast tacos that are not on the menu. My only suggestion is to put that on the every day menu.

Went there on a Saturday at 8:00 and was seated quickly. My husband and I ordered the chicken in a coup. It is sage dressing with pepper sausage gravy with eggs on top. It was okay not spectacular for the price. Coffee was good.

Have been coming to this breakfast joint since they first opened because it is right in our neighborhood. It has been nice watching their success as they have expanded their location to add more seating areas, a community table, and bar (yes, that means they serve alcohol and their drink menu is very fun!). Obviously business is good.    I only have breakfast when I come here (even if it is 12 noon) and my weakness are their pancakes. I'm not even a big pancake eater but these are the best!!! Will usually order them with the egg and bacon combo.  Their bacon is nice and thick and they give you real maple syrup for your pancakes. Love their Mediterranean omelette too. Quality of food is good and my kids love it as well.  My son likes the Chicken on the Coupe (as featured on DDD) and my daughter is a fan of their Dollar Pancakes off the Kids Menu and their Breakfast Burrito.  As with all newer breakfast places these days it seems kind of pricey. Place gets busy on the weekends and the waiting area could be better (majority of waiting area is outside).  Overall we keep coming back.  We like supporting businesses in our community and I need my pancake fix.

Decent prices.  $21 for 2 huge sandwiches.  felt like boa constrictors as we left.  Reuben sandwich was good on terrific rye.  Fries excellent!  Mucho smoocho ( yep, a grilled chicken sandwich with bacon, cheese & special sauce --- it's that kind of place) good, but over-the-moon great.  No wait on a Friday afternoon.  Clearly a family operation -- grandma, teenagers & all.  Nice  change from endless chain restaurants!
No vegetarian friendly options...not even fresh avocado. Good rosemary potatoes though!

We have been here 2 times, as we just found it a few weeks ago!  Excellent pancakes and I tried the corned beef hash today, and it was incredible.  It was perfectly cooked and had fresh rosemary as a nice top garnish and Swiss cheese.  Impeccable wait staff, clean and a nice relaxing atmosphere.

I was not impressed.  My son and I during his Spring Break out for a mom/son date thought we would try Perk.  We had a 10 minute wait just to be seated outside right at the door.  We waiting for 10 minutes and were never acknowledged...I finally flagged another waiter to help.  No one wanted to claim our table.  So we finally got drinks and ordered...well 40 minutes later we finally got our food.  It wasn't that great.  When you have to beg for service it's not a good choice. Otherwise...the sign should say self serve.  As another Yelper stated...the wait staff was clueless of what they were doing.  Too bad since we are new to the neighborhood...this could have been one our regular places...not now.  :(
I love this place!!!!!! Great service and AMAZING breakfast.

I have no idea how this restaurant has such a high rating. We have gone 3 times with high hopes since the reviews are so great but each time we have left disappointed.  Today, we received burnt, cold food with sub-par service. The manager who is great by the way, said he would take 50% off after seeing the burnt food. After waiting a very long time for the check, only one meal was taken off (not 50%) which made us even more dissatisfied. We won't be giving it another try.

We love having brunch at Perk Eatery! The food is always tasty and the service is incredible. I don't think I ever had an empty glass :) Even on the weekends, the staff seats you quickly and brings the fresh food out warm. We'll keep going here again and again!

Finally able to visit Perk Eatery after reading about their potato pancakes in a Phoenix magazine review. First off let me say the restaurant is a charming throwback to an old fashioned diner. The service was excellent. We were immediately greeted, shown a table by a window, and approached by a server who was very friendly and efficient. We went specifically to have breakfast and I ordered the potato pancakes with applesauce. My friend ordered an omelet with toast and coffee. Food arrived in a timely manner and looked great. I was disappointed in the pancakes which really had some potential, but they turned out to be  very limp and greasy, quite a difference from what was described in the magazine, which said they were crispy. The toast was burned, pretty badly. I'm not sure why a cook would serve that to a customer. We just didn't eat it. The coffee was really watery as well. I see other reviews here that are very positive. Perhaps it was an off day but I have had much better food at other breakfast chains so we probably won't return.

Ordered the breakfast enchiladas, took forever to get our meal. When it finally arrived it was barley warm, the tortillas were hard on the outside, the pork on the inside barley visible, ordered eggs over easy one was over easy the other was broken and overdone. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY. PRCEY FOR TWO ENCHILADAS.

I came into Perk Eatery one promising Monday morning with my 17 cats and my large tan prosthetic leg. I am instafamous. Keep that in mind. So, as I hopped into a Perk Eatery, I expected the aroma of fresh ground coffee and pinto bean French toast with freshly curded Brie cheese with a dash of cayenne pepper. Instead, I was greeted by the aroma of freshly sprayed homosapian urine and a man with an axe. The man was covered with even more homosapian feces. As I hopped in I asked the Armenian waiter if he could bring in my 17 cats. He replied "not on my watch, now get in the fryer!". I was furious. Someone asked for a ham omelet which is why he put me, a poor instafamous woman with only a mere prosthetic leg, into the French toast fryer. He told me he was going to chop off my last leg in order to make a ham omelet for the special costumer. I was going to be a completely legless woman all for an egg dish. He started by slowly chopping my leg off with a spork (a spoon shaped eating utensil with spines at the top.) As I watched my leg being incapacitated, I began to bawl. My cats came to the rescue, but it was too late. Overall, my experience was absolutely incredible and delicious even though I didn't eat one bit. I would recommend Perk for an authentic American breakfast for simple living folks.   Peace and blessings, Lucy
Great breakfast place in north Scottsdale! Staff is very friendly and the food is fresh!

The food here was just OK. I had an egg scramble with egg whites. Good but nothing that stood out. The flavor of the rosemary potatoes were good but they definitely could have cooked longer. My husband got the Carmel banana French toast. Would've been really good if the toast wasn't so dry. Maybe we came on an off day. I'll defiantly try it again.

We LOVE perk!!!! During our stay at the Westin, Daniel at the nearby Tommy Bahamas Restaurant recommended Perk, we managed to get there every morning of our stay and wish it wasnt so far from home.  Food sooooooo good and service even better!

Great restaurant! Everything is freshly made. Green jalapeno salsa is not so spicy but oh so tasty. Veggie omelette was so delicious as were the carmelized banana waffles. Only half mile from Westin Villas

Great, great local business. I eat here at least twice per month for breakfast. Went today for lunch for the first time. Arrived at noon. Placed was packed, which I was happy to see. I assume most people were still diving into breakfast/brunch fare.  Opted for lunch type food. Ordered the Mucho Smoocho. Very good roast turkey sandwich on grilled rye bread.  I will be back tomorrow for breakfast. Love the pancakes and the staff. Owners are amazing.
Good service. Food came out quickly. Average food taste. Nice atmosphere. Doesn't take American Express?!!
My co-worker Tom suggested this today for lunch, I had the breakfast burrito, Not bad. The tables and chairs and atmosphere say "self serve" until the waiter comes up and fools ya.

Purchased a LocalDine and was anxious to try the place.  Went on Fri 5/24/13  to find out that their contract expired on 5/20 so they would not honor my July expiration coupon.  Food was very mediocre and not impressed with any of our three choices.  One slice of turkey in a $9 sandwich!!  Yikes.  We will not return.

Love this place! Have eaten here for both breakfast and lunch and both equally great...have turned many friends on to the Perks breakfasts..and they also love it. Your staff is the best and the owners always come around and asked how your meal was...quality food served with great portions...and just delicious! Keep up the good work...your food is outstanding!

I went here for my first time today. We were greeted at the door and seated quickly. Then offered drinks and a chance to look at the menu. I noticed many intriguing dishes. I settled for something I thought was safe , The MAMBO , an omelet with sausage , Swiss cheese , mushroom and onion , to which I added red peppers. The omelet was outstanding and so were the skin-on rosemary potatoes. They have this "secret sauce" with cucumbers that goes perfectly with the potatoes!   I was very impressed with the wait staff. Also impressed that three people working said , "have a good day!" on our exit. I would highly recommend this place!! After reading the five last three star or under ratings on "YELP" I would say these people are the type to complain all the time about everything and IGNORE their reviews. I would bet cash to anyone I know that their experience would be as good as mine was!!  I'm excited to go back.

Delicious food - especially the tuna melt. Friendly staff. Has a walk bar area to eat at and order a mimosa or Bloody Mary. Fantastic menu around holidays. All year menu is good as well but I look forward to see what they come up with Mother's Day Father's Day Easter etc. 4 out of 5 because I hate that I have to wait in the heat once it warms up. And there is always a wait to get in so it is inevitable.

I had gone to The Perk about once a month for the last year or so.  I will not ever go back.  We were waiting for a table for about 1/2 hour so I went next store to get my 2 year old a bagel to hold him over.  They said our table was ready and told me that my 2 year old had to finish his bagel and could not bring it in there.  I thought that is rude and obnoxious of the owner and it was not like she was not getting our business the 3 adults that were with me.  I understand an adult but for a child of that age.  NEVER AGAIN.  There are plenty of good restaurants in the North Scottsdale area the only reason I went here was because it was walking distance from our house. I will walk a little further now to be treated how a customer should be treated.

Wine Country French Toast is the best french toast I have had my entire life. I love that they put brie cheese instead of the sweet cream cheese filling that lost stuffed french toast has. Thick and fluffy, and just dreamy. Definitely recommend!

We've started coming to this place every weekend. With high quality organic ingredients and low prices, you can't beat it. Their food network specials are not the best items on the menu. Anything with their cilantro jalapeño sauce is incredible (and I don't like cilantro!), my wife says the oatmeal is the best she's tasted and their coffee is organic and really good. Do yourself a favor and support Carmen and Pauline and this awesome little place they have!

I get to Phoenix two or three times a year for family visits and when I am in town this is my "go to" place for consistent, quality food at an affordable price. Breakfast is great- I am a particular fan of the huge omelettes and the potatoes. There are also plenty of delicious lunch items to choose from too. Place is at the end of a Safeway shopping center strip that also contains an Einstein Bagels and a Starbucks but Perk is the clear choice if you can get a table. It does get busy at the typical times, but there is outdoor overflow seating and the wait (if there is one) is never too long. Place is clean and the staff could not be any nicer- from the owner to the busboy they all seem genuinely pleased to have you in their restaurant. Give it a try- you won't be sorry.

My husband raved about this place after he had lunch there one day.  He couldn't stop talking about "The Lozoya" sandwich he had.  He loved the cilantro jalapeno sauce that came with the sandwich (which is shocking since he hates cilantro).  So, when we had a free Sunday morning, we went there for a late breakfast, lunch together.  The atmosphere is clean and nice.  It was a bit empty but I think they are still pretty new in town.  I had a Belgium waffle with caramelized bananas (yummy) and a side of corned beef hash (good but the corned beef was just cut whereas I prefer shredded corned beef in my hash).  The meal was good and we will definitely be back.

Perk was delicious! I was initially worried about the wait, but it only took 10 min to get us seated! All the waitresses seemed very efficient and were able to provide great service in a timely manner. We heard about this place from the DDD food network show (since we're from out of town) and thought we would give it a try.   We ordered the breakfast enchiladas, chicken on the coup, and wine country French toast. Each of the dishes were wonderful and my family had a hard time deciding which dish they liked the best.   I definitely recommend it! The food is pretty heavy, but we knew that going in and our stomachs were prepared.
Wonderful food and service! Definitely one of my favorite neighborhood spots. Everything we've had there has been good.
Love the Perk! We always eat here when I'm Scottsdale. Great Food at very reasonable prices. The Country Hash is outstanding.

Poor service (despite arriving at a slow time) , prices are super inflated. $16 for the perk scramble (!!). Vegetables not well cooked or seasoned, red peppers didn't taste "fire roasted", and really, no cheese?  Will not be back.
We have been going to Perk for a few years and absolutly love it!  Love the food, love the atmosphere and service is always fast and friendly!
The pumpkin pecan pancakes were terrific!  Came with eggs and bacon. Excellent breakfast.

It has been 2 years since our last visit. The food was good but the portion size has decreased significantly. The new prices are ridiculous !. We paid $8.59 for a side order of 2 pancakes. 3 ounces of maple syrup cost $2.49. Overall we paid $41.69 for breakfast for 2 without tip included. This place is not worth their prices! We will not return.
Really good people here! The food is also very good. Try the huevos rancheros for breakfast and the chipotle chicken sandwich at lunchtime. Good coffee and very reasonable prices.
Excellent!!!  Had the chicken on the coop, potato leek pancakes and huevos rancheros.  Will definitely be coming back.
I love this place, we go for our monthly girls brunch almost every month ! wish they took amex but other than that the service and management is excellient ! mmm I think I may stop by today :)

Great place, and exceptional food. Our waitress was caring, quick and courteous. Food was out within 10mins, very nice for our little kids. They can definitely benefit from a nicer hostess, who doesn't tell people to close the outer door, or maybe kindly asks!

I was staying at Kierland Villas with my sisters for the weekend and checked Yelp to find a good breakfast place near the hotel and we found Perk. Lucky us. It was really terrific. The best part was the service, just nice, helpful and really attentive.   The food was good, I had a breakfast sandwich with egg, cheese and bacon on whole wheat. Delish. I ordered a fruit plate on the side to counter balance the fat. It was great fruit, blueberries, strawberries and melons. My sisters had omelets, waffles and eggs everyone was happy. I ordered the special coffee and it was very good.   Atmosphere was nice, your basic strip mall neighborhood restaurant. If I find myself up in North Scotts I would eat here again.

I love this food!!!   I've gotten about all of their sandwiches ! They are all yummy!!! The French fries are perfectly cooked !   All the staff is very sweet & they are always there! They take care of me well & since they do I go there often!!!  The Perk has The BEST waffles I have Ever had!!!  I wish they were open at night , too! ;-)
Wonderful food,  wonderful friendly service.  Just a great family owned eatery.

Say this on DDD on food network. Happened to be in AZ for work and came here for breakfast with the co workers. Tried both the enchiladas and the chicken in a coup. Freakin amazing. The chile on top of the enchilada was great. I really like that they pan fry the stuffing to give it an extra crisp for the coup dish. Our server was very attentive and gave us a great overview of their menu.

Their breakfast was great! I got the Baja omelette and was a bit hesitant to have chicken in my omelette, but it was really good! We ended up buying the jalapeño sauce too, which was seems to be good on just about everything! We would definitely come back if we were in the area.

I'm pretty shocked at some of the poor reviews of this place. In the last 2 days we've eaten both breakfast and lunch there. For breakfast, we had pancakes with caramelized bananas and the special breakfast burrito. Both were fantastically prepared and delicious. The service was super friendly and everybody was treated like old friends. The owner came out to greet us and have some conversation. I guess if you don't like this behavior, then you would be happier at Einstein's, where they serve the world's worst bagel.  For lunch, we had the Lozaya, a sandwich with wonderfully seasoned grilled pork, caramelized onions and sweet red peppers. Fantastic! We also had the Perky Turkey salad, everything fresh, well assembled and very delicious.  We would go back to this place at any opportunity.

RIDICULOUSLY OVERPRICED!!! Rude owners!!!  This morning my family of four had breakfast and with two kids my husband and I it was $53 without tip!!!!  we had a discrepancy and spoke with Pauline who is one of the owners and she refused to make any accommodations or any attempts to rectify the situation. Apparently you can't order pancakes as a side or as a substitute you just get charged for two separate breakfasts. Will NOT GO BACK!!! Pauline & Carmen should rethink their policies, ......customers are the ONLY reason you exist and you treat customers (and employees) like DIRT!!

Delicious breakfast. We had ricotta french toast and a Florentine Benedict. I didn't read the menu closely and when I had to send the Benedict back because it had ham (my fault, ) the owner, Carmen, could not have been nicer about making me another, and he added mushrooms too. Also, very clean.

This part of Scottsdale has needed a good breakfast place forever. I mean, how many times can you go to Chompies?! Thought we'd try it out after it's appearance on DDD. Was really looking forward to enjoying the breakfast enchiladas, but was extremely disappointed.  The only flavor on the plate was the sauce. I tried different ingredients without the sauce, and got nothing. The plate was also really plain looking and you'd think there would be a garnish or something. Parsley, kale, potatoes? I don't  judge a dish by its garnish, but when the flavor isn't there, then everything is fair game in my book. My daughter had an omelette with ham, cheese and peppers which was also bland. Hey guys in the kitchen! Flavortown did a show here, how about some flavor!!! The only thing saving this review was the service and our waitress was great, never needed anything and she was very attentive. Having the bar probably also helps draw in the day drinkers. I'll give it another shot when I'm back in town.

An excellent choice for breakfast in the Valley. We stopped in for breakfast on Father's Day. We opted to share the Chicken in the Coop and Breakfast Enchiladas. Both of savory options topped with eggs. Really like both of them. They are very large portions and very well prepared.  N*Joy....

I'm sad that it has taken me so long to find this gem.  The menu has everything from mouth watering Breakfast Burritos with chorizo sauce to your traditional favorites like belgian waffles with berries on them.  Feel like a morning pick me up?  Titos Bloody Mary's to the rescue.  But what really makes this place stand out is their excellent service.  We had several visits from our waiter and our coffee was always topped off.  If you live near here be sure to stop in, you won't be disappointed.

I saw this had good reviews on Yelp and even though it's near ten miles away from moon valley we thought we'd give it a try.   This restaurant is located in a storefront in the far southeast corner of a shopping center. Best access is through the side entrance at 66th Street just south of Greenway. Parking was plentiful.  This isn't a large place, might seat 100 or so in one bright, naturally lit room. It also has a low counter with round stools for 6-8. It was full when my girlfriend and I went at about 9:30 AM this past Sunday morning, though we only waited about 10-15 minutes to be seated.  There's no space designated inside to wait and there's only a few chairs outside to perk oneself until personally summoned by the hostess. I noticed there weren't any misters or shade to be had in the general vicinity so I would imagine an outside wait in the summer would be brutal.  I really didn't find any menu combinations that I instantly fell in love with; I wanted a pancakes, eggs, potatoes and bread combination but I had to order a pancake on the side and settled for an english muffin when I really wanted something more substantial like a bagel. Einsteins bagels is two doors down, you'd think they'd take advantage of the convenience and incorporate bagels into their offerings. I had a small orange juice, it certainly tasted like fresh squeezed and was good but they charge like there's gold dust sprinkled in it.  My girlfriend ordered the sausage/mushroom/onion omelet- while she said she liked it, she would have been happier minus the sausage as it was a ground type as opposed to sliced and was ambiguously flavored (not spicy, not sweet).  She enjoyed the coffee but the wheat toast came incorporated with what looked to me like a combination of seeds and nuts. She didn't bother eating it and thought that information is pertinent to many diners and should be listed on the menu or acknowledged by the wait staff when offering bread selections. She did enjoy the coffee.  The service was standard and the price was a bit more than we like to spend on a simple breakfast; $22 and change including tax, $28 out the door including tip. While there are a number of rave reviews on here about the rosemary potatoes, while we found them just fine we thought they were a bit over-rated and over- powered (taste-wise) the other food on the plate. Maybe best suited for lunch or dinner.  Given the multitude of options, we both agreed we wouldn't be making a return trip even if in the area.

Restaurants need character. They need charm. They need to create an atmosphere. Perk Eatery satisfies all of these for me, without question. And the food? Just right.  I work near Perk, and I've always wanted to stop by and give it a try. Word of mouth made me hesitant, not because of negative remarks, but because everyone I spoke to gushed over the place. I'm normally let down when the bar is set so high.  I strolled in and I was greeted instantly. After being presented with my seating choices, I opted for the breakfast bar. This is when the character kicked in.  If you've been to Perk, you've definitely seen Carmen, zipping around the dining room in his floppy cliché of a chef's hat, running food, filling coffee cups, taking orders, and expediting at the kitchen window. He's a whirlwind of work ethic, moving with a whimsical sense of urgency. Always in a hurry, but never too busy to do as he did when I sat down: deliver incredibly attentive service.  In between calling out "all days" to the cooks and pouring my coffee, he suggested I try the special. The fellow perched on the stool next to me concurred, as he had ordered the same. I mulled over the menu for a bit and glanced up when I noticed the aroma of green chilies. Carmen was delivering the special to my neighbor, the green chili pork omelet. Sold.  The chow at Perk isn't so good because of a lengthy and expensive ingredient list, or because of cutting edge culinary technique. Its just good. Its honest, clean, masterfully seasoned comfort food. My omelet was no exception. It was just an omelet, unassuming in nature, but it was perfectly cooked, and blanketed in melt-in-your-mouth green chili pork. Not too spicy, but HUGE on flavor. I used every last bit of my toast and potatoes to clean my plate, and then I wished I had ordered two.   As I was enjoying my breakfast, my coffee cup never ran empty. I watched as orders came and went. I soaked in the ambiance that Perk creates. In the simplest of terms, its controlled chaos. Extremely friendly, controlled, chaos.   Its like the Cheers of breakfast.   Before I had finished, Carmen took the time to introduce himself, and learned my name as well. I haven't been back in yet, but I'd put my money on guessing he remembers it. I learned later that he owns the joint, which makes the experience even more memorable for me.   To see a proprietor work that hard to deliver satisfaction to his guests is inspiring, and it has definitely encouraged me to rave about his spot to anyone who will listen.
This place is very impressive. The food is all made in house and made with natural ingredients. You can really taste the difference! And the service was great too!

I had no idea this place was here and I go to this shopping plaza probably 2 or 3 times a week. I think its because its tucked in the far southeast corner so its pretty easy to miss if you're not looking for it.  What can I say? I'm SO happy to have a new breakfast place that is cheap with good portions and menu choices. I ordered the veggie omelet which was good, oozing with cheese but I would have reviewed it as excellent if it had more veggies. Their rosemary potatoes might be almost as good as mine!  My daughter ordered the Berry French Toast and this could honestly be a dish to split between two people. It was made with good bread (crucial in my book) may have even been brioche and they sure didn't skimp on the berries!  The prices are very good too so if you need to feed a family on a budget this is a good place. Service was a bit slow but they were packed which is always a good sign.
I eat here about once a month.  Great food and always consistant.  Love the Outlaw Scramble.  Giant portions and excellent service.    Lunch is good too, but I prefer their breakfast.
Good food, great service!  I had the pulled pork and eggs with rosemary potatoes.  Nice atmosphere as well.  Large menu, lots of choices.

1st time here..  layback,relaxful place ,I had the cowboy(steak &eggs) the steak was delicious!!!! moist, tender,!!! the eggs were kind of dry,and cold. potatoes were ok.. nothing special., but the star of the show was there basic pancakes!!! wife gave me that look!! damn!!! coffee was like everywhere else.. service was good   prices start around $14 p.p
Really good place for breakfast. Excellent service and the food is delicious. The breakfast burrito was awesome.
This is my favorite breakfast place... and I'm not a breakfast person so that's say'n a lot! All of the staff are friendly and the place is clean! Amazing food too!!

Found this place when I googled top breakfast in Phoenix.  The food was great I loved the outlaw scramble.  I recommend it to any one that is hungry.  You can tell by the taste of the food they take a lot of pride in the product.
Had a great breakfast here! Chose the Breafast Enchiladas which are two flour tortillas filled with pork, black beans and cheese! The were delicious. The service was good

Went to Perk for my birthday breakfast . This was only my second time here and it still hasn't disappointed us. Friendly staff and amazing food! Everyone in our party always orders something new and everything has been delicious! Why don't I come here more often??!! Love it!

Excellent food excellent service. Can't say enough good things about our experience there this morning. There were 6 of us and we each got something different. I tasted everyone's and nothing was short of amazingly delicious. I feel like we found a gem in the desert.

Perk Eatery definitely has its perks. It's convenient and easy to spot, large enough so that a wait on a Sunday morning isn't bad at all and has outdoor tables for enjoying a leisurely Sunday brunch day. Plus, they had some pumpkin pancakes that I demolished in 5 seconds. Good food, good portion sizes, good service. The staff here is very friendly! All in all this place made for a pleasant Sunday brunch day experience.

The food and location are pretty good, and on my one visit here, I was scoping out this place as a potential meeting venue for a large weekly breakfast  group.  However, their front door sign informed me that they do not respect or understand the rights and safety of their law abiding customers.  Therefore, I will not return or recommend until and unless the sign is removed.

So sad. Been here half a dozen times for breakfast.  It's so good usually.  Came in for lunch. My server basically rushed me then ignored me other then to place down a bill. The younger guy that delivered my food was more pleasant.  Lunch was soggy n greasy. Fries were cold. I'll stick to breakfast were I haven't seen this server either!

This was my first time at Perk but it will not be my last. I was here for the May edition of the famous Breakfast Club put on my Monica O. It was really good. I had the famous Breakfast Enchiladas. There is a reason they are famous. Just the right amount of spice. Spice for breakfast sure will wake you up. The pork with the chipotle ricotta and the beans with the eggs on top just all worked together so perfectly. Then topped with the New Mexico red chili sauce that added that spice that brought it all together. Then there was the corned beef hash that I spilt with fellow breakfaster Scott W. I almost didn't want to share. That was amazing too. The corned beef with the country style potatos and the rosemary to set it all off. I couldn't stop eating it. It was hard to pick which I liked more the enchiladas or the hash but the enchiladas won in the end. Not that I will ever turn down the hash again. I will be back to try more wonderfulness off of their menu. I really want to see how their pancakes are. If you can't do good pancakes what kind of breakfast place are you. I'm sure they will be just as fantastic as everything else.

This is a great new neighborhood place and worth visiting.  All fresh ingredients, not pre-cooked.  All the servers are friendly and knowledgeable about the the menu - ask them why each item was named the way it was.  It may be empty at times, but then come at 10am on a Sunday!    Our only complaint is that the menu is set, we couldn't get a make your own omelet.... which is really a bummer at a breakfast spot.  Hopefully they'll change that.  We have eaten here twice for breakfast and once for lunch and looking forward to going back soon.  Finally, it's not a cheap place, but not overpriced either.  Reasonable value for what you're getting, and that's fair.

Every bite lives up to the hype! We saw this place on Guy Fieri's D, D and D and came shortly after I flew into Phoenix. The service was wonderful: warm, friendly, and patient, even though we arrived 15 minutes before closing. They didn't rush us, explained the menu, and served us delicious food. We ordered the breakfast enchiladas (with house made Mexican red chili sauce), chicken of the coup, pancakes and huevos rancheros. Every single plate was finished clean. Then Carmen the owner came out, greeted us as friends though we were first-timers, and made us feel the hospitality of this great find of a restaurant. A must!

Sooo good! First time here on Saturday for breakfast. Was told there was a 5-10 minute wait but ended up being about 2 minutes. Our server Aldonna was fabulous. She gave us great suggestions that we appreciate. I had the corned beef hash that was fresh and had great flavor. My husband had the Chicken on the Coup. I had a taste and it was a home run! My hubby felt the same and it was devoured. The food came our quickly and was hot. The only complaint I did have was not being offered a refill on the coffee but overall it was fantastic!

We have been on a brunch kick lately and tried to visit a local restaurant but they had too long of a wait. After searching on Yelp, we discovered Perk nearby with no wait at all. After a short drive, we remarked that it looked like a bunch of old people inside. As we were walking up to the door, we said, "if we don't like it, we never have to come back."  We arrived inside and noticed a diversity of ages. We were seated immediately and began looking over the menu. They have a bar which I think used to be a kids play area. The menu is expansive and we discovered that it had also been on the Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives show on the Food Network.  I ordered the French Toast Combo (two slices of french toast, two eggs, and bacon) along with a café mocha. Spouse ordered an omlet with rosemary potatoes and toast and coffee. Our coffees came out first and then a while later, the food. The portion size again was great, enough for two meals. I accidently spilled the syrup all over the plate, and I don't like my eggs in syrup so they brought me a smaller plate to which I could transfer the eggs.  Everything was delicious and cooked perfectly. The rosemary potatoes were quite tasty. We were pleasantly surprised that this was a great brunch place and we will return if we are in the area!
Really great local breakfast spot. The signature enchiladas are delicious. They make fantastic bloody Mary's and I haven't tried anything on the menu that I wouldn't order again.

All I can say is "Yum Yum in my Tum". everything is made from scratch !!! This place puts a tweak on all of their items . I had the best caramelized banana waffle , if you are allergic to nuts tell them to make yours without the walnuts. So,my AZ peeps ,wake up and go for the drive ... it won't disappoint! As always when you go let me know and enjoy

Found this place on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives.  A little pricey, but the burrito was good and my husband's Huevos Rancheros was wonderful.  The rosemary potatoes my daughter had were also really good! Worth stopping..

Ridiculous that in 2017 they do not serve any gluten free items. This is including ones that should be such as breakfast meats, eggs and potatoes. We sat down and then left because of this. Will not be returning either.

Yes, I'm not cool enough to have liked this place before it was on TV. Yes, I watch diners and dives even though Guy Feiri is a giant tool. Don't judge me, they go to some good places.   Place was large,  open and clean and service was prompt and friendly.   I had the chicken on the coup and it was a great take on comfort food. This is stuffing covered in gravy, it is neither light or healthy,  but it is delicious.   Wife had breakfast enchiladas and the flavor of the pork was really good. The Chipotle ricotta was a unique twist to them as well.

I have never had a bad meal here. The guys in my office swore by it and they were so right! I love finding gems like this that are not big chain restaurants. Delicious original recipes, always fresh and they are so nice! Everything is good, you cannot make a bad choice!:)

Perk was recommended by a friend who is local to the area. My boyfriend and I were visiting from NYC and determined to eat local.Being foodies we were so excited to hear that Guy from The Food Network ate here. I had the enchiladas.....delicious! My boyfriend had the pancakes.....these had to be the BEST pancakes we have ever had. Light, fluffy and melts in your mouth. Great service and friendly locals.

The best breakfast spot in Arizona in my opinion!! The owner Carmine is a great guy and the food is outstanding. Very crowded on the weekend but well worth the wait, especially since they expanded and added a bar, pretty good bloody mary's as well!!!
Great food and coffee at a reasonable price
Had breakfast on Saturday....homemade hash and eggs!  The coffee was great and the staff was prompt and friendly!    I recommend this place for a good meal!!!

This morning, I had the Irishman Omelet with house made corned beef, swiss, and mushrooms, and it profoundly impacted my overall quality of life. I am now prepared to enter 2014 with poise, confidence, and several extra pounds that were TOTALLY worth it.
They don't take AMEX and their food is really bland.  Guy Fieri is full of crap. Last time I get burned on a Food Network referral.

The staff if friendly, the service is quick, the coffee is tasty, and the food is ah-maz-ing. I drool just thinking about Perk Eatery, especially the Chicken on the Coup...and the Wine Country French Toast...and the breakfast burrito. Just go.  Yes, you most likely will have to wait a bit for a table but it is so worth it. They recently expanded into the space next door which is great but I think they still need to be bigger!
Wine Country French Toast & Chicken on the Coop

Perk Eatery is one of the best breakfast places in the Scottsdale area.  It's family owned, and serves good quality food. It's not a chain, but instead your typical midwestern breakfast diner with warm folks and good food.  Good job!

This place is everything you would want in a tex-mex, southwestern style breakfast.  We went here starving and ready to get our coffee/Mimosa fix taken care of.  We were seated right away on a Saturday morning around 10:30 or so.  It's nice and bright and the place is just buzzing with all things breakfast.  They even have a full bar that's set up really cute.  I ordered the Perk Scramble...Holy hell...It was everything I loved.  Lots of eggs scrambled with roasted red peppers, bacon and onions.  The red peppers were so flavorful and the bacon added the perfect amount of savory and saltiness.  Coffee was on point and they keep your cup filled.  Will definitely be back Perk! :)

We visit this restaurant because we saw it on Guy Fieri's show. We were very surprised and disappointed that he endorsed this place. The wait time was minimal, but the service took FOOOOOREVEEEER! The food was bland and cold. We won't be going back.

Food was very good, service was fast and friendly.  Perhaps I'm a tough reviewer and there's really nothing wrong here but Perk just didn't feel like some of the other five-star breakfast places.  If you want good, fast, friendly, Perk works.

Best pancake in the city. Hands down.  I'm going to eat there right now. I'm on my way. They need new breakfast potatoes hashbrowns anything is better than what they serve with their omelet but it is a good spot overall

Boy oh boy, what a fun time I had in Scottsdale and how exciting is it to open up my yelp app to figure out where to go for breakfast.  I came across a few places and this place really stood out by the sheer number of reviews and also this godly Corned Beef Hash dish that I knew instantly, "I must have this, now!"  The four of us showed up and were seated quickly.  Our lovely waitress, who must have been from the South originally, couldn't have been friendlier and made us feel instantly welcome.  We ordered the necessities, coffee and fresh orange juice.  Next we gave her our order of the corned beef hash, a couple orders of breakfast enchiladas, and some biscuits and eggs.  We planned on sharing everything.  Any meal, with my fellow familial diners, is never uneventful and naturally, someone knocked over a glass of orange juice sending us panicking for the hills as this delicious nectar was everywhere, literally everywhere.  The waitress and some other staff quickly came over and cleaned it up and even gave this fellow mistaken-prone diner, a new glass.  This little gesture meant so much in my book and I really appreciated the fact that they replaced something that wasn't their fault.  So the food comes and it is everything I was expecting.  The breakfast enchiladas were delicious, maybe needed a little something I can't quite put my finger on but it was, without a doubt, very delicious.  The star of the meal and probably the restaurant was the Corned Beef Country Style Hash.  It was SO AMAZING.  I wanted more and thinking about it now, waiting for my coffee in the coffee press, and staring at plain yogurt on my desk makes me want that meal now more than ever.  With roasted potatoes, huge chunks of corned beef, and then just the right amount of rosemary, this was one of my favorite breakfast dishes, other than eggs benedict.  I absolutely recommend locals and out of towner's alike to visit this place if you haven't already and take advantage of the great service and delicious breakfast food.  I hope I get the chance to visit again!  Take care & savor it up!

Finally made it over to the Perk.  This place has been on the bookmarks for years.  Located on the SE corner of 64 St and Greenway Parkway in the Safeway strip mall.  The inside is small and basic.  A bar area, a few chairs for waiting, and the dining room area.  I ordered the corned beef hash special.  Good portion decent food.  Lots of corned beef, some potatoes, side of eggs, and toast.  The corned beef had a good flavor and was generously added.    I tried my sons waffle and it was decent.  It was on the limp side but had a good flavor.  I prefer my waffles to be crisp on the edges and fluffy in the middle.  This one was neither.  The service was good.  The hostess was friendly and waiter was prompt.  The price for the food was a little high for the quality.  I would have expected some better toast, better waffles, and maybe a side of homemade jam.  While it was good I don't think I'd go out of my way to come back or highly recommend.

Was excited to try a spot we saw featured on Triple D that always seemed to have quite a crowd waiting. With family visiting we had a large party that ordered an assortment of items. Most were completely forgettable though my Chicken on the Coup was a pleasant and unique dish.   Perhaps I should came in with overly inflated expectations due to the television feature and the price, but I was completely let down. There are a number of breakfast restaurants in the area that stick in my mind. Perk sadly is not one of them

Simply put, this place rocks. The only way it could get better would be for them to open a location in downtown Phoenix.  Amazing food, perfect service, and a great value make this place a home run. I've only been here two times, but was already made to feel like a regular, which is awesome. Perk has great ambiance, is very clean- and the service is wonderful.  In addition to great dine-in food, they have take-out which is fast and accurate.   Keep up the great work Perk, I look forward to many more tasty breakfasts!

Good Food...I came specifically since I saw them listed as a top Breakfast place in the North Valley by New Times and I love finding the best breakfast spots myself...can't give 5 stars since they don't take AMEX, huge frustration for a customer to be told how they have to pay...plus AMEX is a major employer in the area...shouldn't alienate a  great set of customers that help fill your seats...add AMEX and I will be back!
This place is all about the breakfast enchiladas. SO GOOD! Service is good too, but watch out for the dairy based drinks. They can be iffy. Still a great place though.

Finally made it in to Perk Eatery today.   I LOVED it. It has a very nice decor. The restaurant is spotless, the way I like it.....Nice and CLEAN. (The restroom was very clean also.)   We ordered the Huevos Rancheros and the Fancy Pants Scramble. Both dishes were incredibly tasty.   The Cilantro jalapeno sauce on the Huevos Rancheros was delicious. I would order this again in a heartbeat.   The Fancy Pants Scramble was to die for. The Fig Compote in this dish really made it unique. What an amazing combination of flavors.   I am thankful I saw the TV segment about this place on Fox 10 morning show recently, otherwise I might not have known this fabulous restaurant existed.  I will be back many more times.   Perk Eatery puts The Good Egg and Mimi's Cafe to shame. Absolutely no comparison.  You will not be disappointed in this wonderful Eatery.

For the past 2 years now 8 of us dine around the Valley and have formed a critique team. We are in search for the best breakfast location in our area. We have tried over 30-40 locations and have a certain criteria we grade on. In no particular order we grade on service, taste of food, ambiance of decor, attentiveness of staff if an issue arises, overall experience and so on. We have experienced from 1-4 stars until now. Perk gets a 5 star rating from all of us!! Shout out to Giavonni at Perk as he was the best server ever and dealt with our every need fast and with a smile. Long story short.... EXCELLENT EXCELLENT EXCELLENT!!  Go to Perk if you want the best. Thanks for a top notch breakfast experience PERK.

Delicious brunch spot. Veggie Omelet with egg whites was good. When we arrived we had to wait 10 minutes while the hostess ran around doing things and there were open tables for four abundant. Otherwise, delicious food and friendly service. We will be back.

I yelped a place for breakfast, and chose Perk because of the decent prices (not too high) and the location, plus Guy Fieri's picture probably influenced me, to be honest. He doesn't choose lousy spots! We had friendly service on what appeared to be a slow Tuesday morning. Just like we like! We could've sat outside, which would have been pleasant, but the 5-year-old chose inside. No problems. I was happy to be eating out in a quiet place. It's also nice when you see locals enjoying themselves. It wasn't trendy and hip and loud.  My food was average. I had oatmeal. You can't mess that up! My daughter had 3 chocolate chip silver dollar pancakes with watermelon - a nice touch we can't get in PA this time of year! And my husband had a breakfast burrito. It was big and full and fantastic, according to him.   There's not much more to say. I was satisfied!

Excellent breakfast.  Portions were more than ample, service was attentive.  You could tell the place draws it's regulars, but it's a good option for visitors as well.  I had an egg sandwich on ciabatta bread, and my partner had pancakes.  We were both pleased.

Wow!  How did so many people rate this a 4 or 5?   We went there this morning for breakfast for our first time, and I might add....our only time.  For starters, even the coffee is not quality coffee.  Then we went on to the menu and we ordered eggs.  They must make a batch of scrambled eggs and spoon them on the plate when an order comes in.  Mine were dry, over cooked and maybe just plain sitting under a heat lamp.  My husband ordered eggs with cheese.  The first time they were cold and the sheet of cheese was hardly melted!  Service was good, but there was nothing on this menu to get us back.  We are fairly discerning consumers, and I don't know why people would go back if they messed up on the basics!

Ok, so we have lived close by and never knew this gem was here until the Diners show.   Wanted to go, but never made it.  I read the yelp reviews this morning and one reviewer said " Stop reading and go!"   So, we did just that and we were so happy we did! I was worried it would be too busy just before 10 am on a Sunday, but other reviews said they didn't have long waits.  Exactly true! We were told 5 minutes and that is exactly how long we waited.  The staff is super friendly and professional.  The food is to die for! French toast so light it is heavenly! Pancakes golden and delicious. The huevos rancheros is AMAZING, AMAZING, AMAZING!   So worth it! Stop reading and go!  Super happy to have this gem in our hood! We will be regulars!
Terrible breakfast. You'd think if you make as many eggs you'd know how to do them right.  Better eggs at the hotel egg station.

Ok this place is HIGHLY OVER RATED! I really would pass. The food was mediocre are best, slightly cold when served. Asking for refills on coffee or ice tea was like waiting for Congressional Approval...   The menu looks enticing overall, even gives one hope, but seems to fall desperately short of combining what promises to be really good combination of flavors.   Unfortunately the service was just as abysmal. Nice people, sweet, like molasses's about the same speed.  There are so many great places in the Metro Phoenix/Scottsdale Area.  Don't stop, keep on driving or go to Einstein Bagels next door. You will be much happier.
Good food.good service. Terrible coffee. Always come back, but each time the coffee is so weak!

We love going to this place! Never have a bad meal. Busy on weekends but worth wait. Staff is friendly and food comes quickly.  My favs are the pumpkin pancakes and Mediterranean omelet. Kid friendly too.  Beats any of the other breakfast places around here!
I cannot give enough stars!! Food is perfection and staff is polite, welcoming and entertaining! If you don't check this place out, you're missing a good time and great food!!
Consistently good food with some unique flavors and new twists on old favorites. Not your typical diner/breakfast joint.

It is a good breakfast place it became famous after drives dives and diners.they have pretty good service however my first dish came out called they take it back and it came out a lot better. That was the Sonora kitchen scrambled.

Just found this place, what a find! Service was great and the food was even better! The rosemary potatoes are the best I've ever eaten!! Also a plus, this place is kept impeccable, very clean! Believe the hype!!

This is a cozy little place in a strip that you would not notice unless someone told you to meet them there.  I am lucky as I happen to live around the corner.  Great service and food.  The chef or cook or manager is very attentive.    I guess I am not sure as he has the chef's hat on and also comes around to make sure everyone enjoys their food. And the rest of the staff is very nice.  The rosemary potatoes are nice change to basic hashbrowns (of which I am always a fan).  Oh and you can get lattes and caps, as well as, regular coffee and tea.  I recommned it.  And during the week there is never a wait.
Great food, nice people, strip mall diner vibe to it.   Really good.  Can't go wrong.

Excellent local business. Very fresh, very creative, very flavorful and mostly locally-sourced (if I am not mistaken) dishes. And the difference in taste is palpable. A robust menu. Excellent service and ambiance. My go-to dish, the greek salad, is amazing. And other items are excellent as well. This is a very feel-good type place. My only qualm is the 3 pm closing time, because I would almost certainly frequent this restaurant for dinner.

Best Breakfast in Phoenix.  Every January when I come to Phoenix this is a must stop eatery for me. Portions are generous, the staff is amazing, and the food is out of this world! I'd recommend coming during the week because the weekends are packed.
Not to impressed with service at the bar for single women.  Servers more interestes in talking amongst themsleves.  For claiming they have midwest roots, they sure have a stuck up  attitude.

We have been interested in this place since it was on tv awhile back but it was always busy with a long wait.  We had breakfast and were mostly happy with our choice. I suppose it will always be busy on Sunday morning and it was hectic.  It was also efficiently run.    The noise level was sometimes a challenge and food trays can block the aisles.  We had great service. Our waitress refilled water often. When my wife asked for more butter, it appeared instantly.  I had a Perk-Fect Bloody Mary and it was good.  My wife had the pumpkin pancake combo and was pleased.  I had the cheesy hash, toast, potatoes and egg menu item. It was very rich but I got through it. I prefer potatoes in a hash dish to be bite sized. These were on the upper end for that.  My food came luke warm and I prefer my toast hot and the eggs and potatoes hot.  I ate quickly. I suppose my plate was put aside waiting for pancakes.

A hidden gem for breakfast in Scottsdale, perk eatery is legit. Big portions, delicious, healthy. I ordered an omelette which hit the spot! Reminds me of Matt's big breakfast downtown. Very low key, authentic. Perk has a mom n pop feel to it. Easily a top 5 breakfast restaurant in valley. I will be coming back for more soon!

After all the hoopla and all the recommendations finally decided to give this place a shot. I'm with my best friend and my 3 year old son.  We walk in and get seated right away. place looks really nice and plenty of people vouch for it. We sat down and not a single word has been said by our server. we start looking at the menu and talking it over with my friend and son. A family sits next to us and still waiting for a 4th person. the server walks up to them and gives them the run down walks to get them coffee and waters. walks back and helps the 4th person get into their seat. he explains the menu and says he will be back shortly. He walks to the other table on our other side, helps them and asks of they need anything else. We are ready to order and he keeps walking and helping everyone else around us. The man next to us leans over and says " want me to order for you guys? i can clearly see whats going on" I say no thank you. I wait another 10 minutes and still nothing. my son is asking for pancakes and juice. The man and family next to us receives their meals and are looking at us ashamed considering they arrived around 10 minutes after us and to this point the server has yet to say 1 single word to us. I finally have had enough and wave down the "server" he shockingly walks over and i ask for the manager he doesn't say a word and walks away. Him and another man walk towards me the "server" sarcastically says "did i forget to serve you" i told the manager the story and that i was leaving. he said "OK have a nice day"  everyone looked as us as we got up put our coats on and heard my son saying he wanted pancakes. As a purple heart recipient from the war in Iraq this is not what i think about when i think of America. I don't think i have ever felt this from a business. the embarrassment and walking away like we did something wrong by walking out. No single apology or NOTHING. So i cant recommend a business in which didn't even serve us a glass of water. I can assure that neither I or anyone I know will ever attend this establishment after this incident. NO APOLOGY WAS EVER RECEIVED.
This place is packed!!! And wow does this look tasty! Omg delish!!!!
Ate here this morning had the French toast with caramel banana topping. So so yummy . Mambo omelet very average. Potatoes over cooked, very dark and greasy. Staff were extremely friendly

We are never coming back here again. We came as a big group of 20 and the owner and waiter Sue will not do split check. They were rude and practically said no to almost every request we made. Then if we order for our kids, they would bring the food to us and we had to deliver it to our kids, which was just across us. The waiter Sue has so much attitude and was rude and even stomped the cups and plates as she put it down. She never smiled and was hardly there to ask if we need anything else.  The food wasn't that good too. The potato with corned beef was awful.  So sad that ever since they got bigger they became a snub and forgot about good customer service. They even said that the area they placed us in had a minimum of $500...that's total BS.  Never again!!!!

The breakfast enchiladas were amazing! No pic to share because I ate it all too quickly ;-) Also had the huevos rancheros which was equally delicious, wish we could eat this every day. Great coffee and great service, 5 stars!

My girlfriend and I stumbled on this place while doing some early morning errands and we were both pleasantly surprised. It's nice, clean, well lighted and locally owned, which is a big plus for us considering the amount of chains in my area.   We ordered french toast and their Pumpkin pancake special. They both were really great, to the point of being stuffed -  we skipped lunch altogether.   She ordered a cappuccino, which she wasn't too thrilled with, and that was the only knock. My standard cup o' coffee was just fine.  The service was attentive and all of the staff was incredibly friendly.   We will definitely be going back.

I love this place!  Close your eyes -- imagine the local diner of your dreams... Open you eyes -- you have arrived at Perk!  Amazing food (it is super consistent, never a bad meal here) with customer service that is always on point.    The pancakes and omelettes are tops!
So very good!  Pancakes, chorizo breakfast burrito w homemade jalapeño cilantro salsa, everything is terrific.  My kids love it too.  Wish it was closer to my house.

Hubby took me here for my birthday breakfast. We were welcomed warmly and seated promptly. Our server was friendly and on top of his game. Prompt but not in a rush.  We find many restaurants too noisy but Perk wasn't bad at all. We were at a table by the window and it got a little warm. I moved to the other side of the table and we were comfortable. There's a small patio but it overlooks the parking lot so that wouldn't be my first choice.  The food -- oh my! I had the French toast with Caramelized bananas and a side of sausage links. THe food was delicious, hot, generous portions. Hubby had the steak and scrambled eggs with toast, and rosemary potatoes. He said the filet was perfectly tender and cooked just right. It was a huge plate of food but he ate all of it. Now, we had some of the more expensive items on the menu and our bill came to $36. This is not a cheap breakfast but we would definitely come back.  They are also open for lunch and I think well give it a try. The burger with Brie sounds so good!

What a cute find!  I love a place where breakfast items are served in the afternoon. Attentive and friendly service with great food.  I noticed they also serve organic coffee, which actually isn't that easy to find.

It would be better if the server listens to the customer's order, submit the order, and when the order comes out, CHECK the order against what is actually on the plate. I ordered pancakes, with eggs over medium and bacon. What came out was pancakes, scrambled eggs, and a sausage. I pointed out that, there are 2 mistakes on the plate. However, I will keep the egg, but do not wish to keep or eat the sausage. In fairness, the server did apologise, and said he'll bring out the bacon. The bacon did not arrive until I almost finished the pancakes and the eggs. The server brought the bacon on a small plate, told me to slide the bacon off of his plate on to mine. Then, the server asked me to put the sausage that was on my plate on to his plate.  First. Apology does not unring the bell! Second. I hope the sausage was not recycled and got on to someone else's plate  Finally, I am certain the smug server expected his gratuity none-the-less. The management should train the servers more effectively.

Oh Breakfast Club, my favorite social group, just what would we do without you? I for one would probably eat a lot less breakfast, and I wouldn't have such awesome people to hang with, that's for sure.  The long trek ensued from my humble abode in Cenpho, Monica, I hope you know I don't travel this far for just anyone. Finally landing on the huevos rancheros, my taste buds were excited to dig in. The cilantro jalepeno sauce was delicious with a good mixture of spice and flavor, it was tasty.  With a decent sized group of 12 or so, the staff were able to accommodate us without many hiccups at all. We all chatted, got to know each other more, hung out, and had a great time. Be sure to try this place out soon!  Happy Yelping Phoenix!

I went here for lunch with a co-worker after trying to find someplace new.  It's a nice little breakfast & lunch diner.  Food and service was good and the prices are very affordable. Our waiter was very on top of our drinks when they would get low and checked in just the right amount of times.  Good find in a large shopping center :)

We were surprised to find this breakfast spot mostly vacant at 7:30 AM on a Friday morning. I had the corned beef hash with Swiss cheese on top and fried potatoes. Pretty good, but I thought it was on the greasy side. My wife had an omelette with two eggs and she thought it was decent. Overall, we weren't completely swept off our feet, but it was a-ok.

Not enough money in the universe for me and my friends to go to Perks again. Rude manager. The word I would like to use to describe her I can not print. Our waitress was great but that manager is one angry human being. Spoils the visit. Food OK nothing to write  home about. Little season in dressing. Corn beef not great.I will stick to Mimi's or Chompies.

I was excited to check out this Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives spot with some girlfriends today for lunch and it did not disappoint!  The service was so friendly and welcoming, the atmosphere was casual and nice and the food was great.  I enjoyed the chicken gyro and loved every bite of it.  Definitely worth a stop for a quick breakfast or lunch while in the Kierland area.

Sampled the classic pancakes, Western omelet, and Gordo omelet. All good. The Gordo is definitely tastier than the Western. The Omelets are traditionally served with rosemary potatoes and toast.  Nothing outrageously good but if you need a place with great service and accessible, give this place a try. The price is on the high end for breakfast. The servers are more than attentive. Had 5 different people ask how we were doing on top of the typical rounds by our server. This place gets packed on the weekends. Less than 1/2 a mile from the Westin Hotel. Giving this place a 3, again its good but nothing stands out and the price point could be better.

Well, thank goodness for another fabulous recommendation on Triple D. We were tempted to try both the Chicken Coop and Breakfast Enchiladas for breakfast but opted to actually SHARE the Breakfast Enchiladas. We arrived before 9am and there was a small wait. Very friendly staff. Owner kept coming out and visiting guests and helping staff. The enchiladas were plenty to share actually and very filling. We will be back to try the Coop. Who doesn't love stuffing for breakfast.

If your looking for your normal breakfast don't come here if your looking for modern breakfast with a twist then you might like it here. I just wasnt a fan of rosemary potatoes in the morning or slow roasted pork with eggs.

I used to love Perk but this morning it was not good.  The service was terrible and my husband and I both complained that the rosemary potatoes were very under cooked and tasted like they were made yesterday. The waiter did nothing and said nothing.  No apology, no offer of something else. We let the owner know, assuming other people would not be able to eat them either.   He said they were using different potatoes.  That's it.  Between the service and changes in food quality, we won't be back. No one seems to care any more.
