It's just really yummy and the corned beef isn't from a can so that's what's up!!  I also always HAVE to get a chocolate chip pancake. Like have to. It's one of those "so good makes you want to slap yo mama" type good. It has just the right fluff and chocolate chips. Just make sure to get you a pancake and you can thank me later :-)  It's a husband and wife that own the restaurant and supporting local is where it's at. They are awesome and even remember my name every time I go in. The servers are just as great and always take care of us!!

We came in on a Saturday afternoon and were seated immediately. Must've came at the end of the rush because the place began to thin out. Good thing we're late risers on weekends!  I can't remember what we ordered - both omelets and potatoes - but they were both really good and fulfilling. I didn't know Triple D was here, but they definitely flaunt it in the restaurant.  They forgot to bring out my girlfriend's toast, but the waiter was really nice and helpful. We were in and out pretty fast, had lots of stuff planned for the rest of the day, so we didn't bother asking or complaining about the toast at the time.  I'm not a fan of the open/cafeteria style seating, which is why it's 4-stars instead of 5. I have ADD and OCD, and I'm a former Marine, so I don't do well in open social settings. I like to spend time with my girlfriend, but I was like a dog in a squirrel forest. Too close to other people for my comfort.   However, with that said, I am a rare breed of animal and none of this bothered my better half. We both loved the food and I'll just remember to take my chill pill before we go here again, because yes, we will be back again and again and again.

I lived in Phoenix for three years and this is the best breakfast I've had hands down.  Owner always says hello and he is down to earth.  Great service every time I've been there.  Pancakes are to die for!!!

Perk serves up the best burger in this part of town - nice and greasy, substantial size and full of flavor.  I am in love with the pumpkin pecan pancakes I had last time - pancake batter with some pumpkin and chopped pecans mixed in.  Served up with butter and REAL MAPLE SYRUP.    They have always done a great job getting people sat as quickly as possible, when there is a wait.  Super organized and you can sit in the bar while you wait.  But the wait wasn't very long at all.  Service is very friendly and helpful about navigating the menu and your preferences/dislikes.  Highly recommend!

Watch out this place will nickel & dime you. Thought we would give this place a second shot and we totally regretted it. My son ordered the ham & cheese roll up and he asked if he could have turkey instead. They said yes for a $1 extra! Seriously.  Best marketing is word of mouth...remember that.
Amazing service ! The best Belgian waffles! The fancy pants scramble was delicious and also chicken on the coup! Will be back!

I like this little place! I think I enjoy its friendly staff the most!   The food is good, limited on the non pork options, but I think I am in the minority of people who don't care for pork.   I was very pleased with the corned beef hash!. It is very hard to find homemade corned beef hash so I was delighted when I got my plate and could easily tell it wasn't from a can and tasted good.   The cappuccinos are good, most of the time, but I think some of the staff isn't sure how to use the machine.   Overall, it's a nice breakfast place.

We have now been to Perk three times in the last three weeks.  We eat breakfast/brunch out every day and happy to have found this restaurant.  The waite staff is great...the menu is wonderful....and the food is terrific.  Very innovative creations.  My only negative is, that I feel badly for people who come in by themself and the hostess says "ONLY ONE"!  It really sounds awful and not very tactful. Otherwise, a fan.

A little more pricey than some other breakfat joints but the big portions and waitstaff make up for that.  Everyone has a smile and very attentive.  Nice, bright and upbeat inside (despite being in a strip mall)  I agree with other reviews that the rosemary potatoes are awesome.  One word of advice save the speciality coffee drinks for starbucks and just order the old fashion kind (you know the one that comes from a pot).
We had the Outlaw Scramble and the Lemon Curd French Toast.  Both were delicious if we are ever back in the area we will be back!

Amazing! Friendly staff, great service, clean and very inexpensive! We spent a week in Arizona (Scottsdale, Sedona and the Grand Canyon and  basically every morning that we were in Scottsdale we went here.   Our first day (and again on our third visit) I had the Wine Country French Toast ($11.99) that was featured on DDD. This dish was so incredible and what a deal...a huge portion of French toast stuffed with French Brie topped with roasted red grapes and red wine rosemary (trust me the flavours work!) syrup. The ingredients alone enticed me. If you look up the recipe on the food network, it uses a whole cup of Pinot noir! Needless to say, I had to come back and have it again when we got back from Sedona. My husband had the pork sandwich (8.99) with a side of delicious watermelon which he thoroughly enjoyed and ordered it again on our third trip back.  On the 2nd visit I had the chicken on the coup which is crispy sausage and sage stuffing topped with peppery sausage gravy and 2 eggs which I got over medium and they were cooked to perfection. I love my egg yolks runny but the whites cooked and these were perfect.  The gravy was a little peppery but not overly so. A delicious dish but had to go back to the French toast on the third visit. Our waitress was amazing...on our third visit we left a 20 tip on a 20 dollar bill. Everyone there is just so nice. I even saw the owner push the wheelchair of one of the customers to his car ( he was an older gentleman).   Amazing. I wish we had such a place in Toronto!
Very very good food and service was excellent . Very clean . We got our food in less that 15 minutes , I'm coming back here for sure . walking distance from the hotel ..
This is the BEST place for breakfast or brunch! They seat you quickly even though there is always a crowd. Outdoor and indoor seating. Great bloody's too! Highly recommended!

I really have to try this place again. It's suppose to be really good and it was even on diners, drive ins, and dives.  I got the Chicken in the coupe, no chicken in this... ?? It was pretty tastey at the beginning but toward the end it just got very heavy.  I will have to come back and try the breakfast.

I don't have any pictures because I was mesmorized by my perfect plate of breakfast. Two sunny side up eggs with rye toast, sausage, and rosemary seasoned potatoes. Our waitress was sweet and efficient, our drinks were dropped in a timely fashion, and I just love a busy and bright atmosphere for sunday morning brunch! If you're not in the mood for eggs they also have great looking sandwiches, burgers, salads, and soup! There is a full service bar and the food came out in perfect timing! I'm so happy we found this cute and delicious ma and pop restaurant. My husband and I will be back for we have dubbed this place our new breakfast spot!!

Nice little neighborhood place for breakfast. We walked in and was greeted right away. The service was friendly, welcoming and had a few people asking about our meal. We order and then boom, the food was at our table. Very quick.  I ordered the Irish omelet and it comes with rosemary potatoes and your choice of toast. Thought the omelet was fluffy and pretty good. I thought the amount of food was very reasonable. Not too much and not too little. My wife had the scramble eggs and fruit and just gobbled it up. I had sour dough toast and my wife had white toast. I thought the food was good but nothing special.

THE BEST WAFFLE EVER. Honestly no other waffle compares, I'm literally still dreaming of the waffle.   SO light and airy. The fruit were extremely fresh and they didn't skimp out on the amount of fruit, love that! I can't wait to go back here! Don't miss out.

My favorite place!  The last time my husband and I were in Scottsdale we ate there 5 out of 6 days for breakfast and one day lunch.  We had something different every day and we were not disappointed - my favorite was the pancakes - yum!!    We always have the best service and the staff remember us when we come back in the area.  We love that, feels like home and I drink my morning tea a certain way and one waiter always remembers even if its months between visits.  I can not recommend Perk enough, food is wonderful and service is great!  Can't wait to go back.

My vacation girl and I had a car rental for two days, and went here for breakfast, based on my fellow Yelpers reviews.  We enjoyed our breakfast so much that we returned the next morning.  Delicious omelettes; I had the "Border Patrol" the first morning, and the "Sonoma" the next day (yes, that's enough eggs for a while!).  My favorite part was the rosemary potatoes that accompany the eggs...yummy!  Nice staff, good chow; if we lived in the area, this would be our go-to breakfast place.

4.5 stars if it was a choice! Food is delicious, service is friendly and courteous!  Only complaint is can hardly get the raw sugar out of the glass dispenser - sugar crystals are too big for the opening! Please do something about it :)

Pretty good breakfast/lunch joint.  My son loved his enormous pancakes.  I loved the sausage that came with it.  My MIL really enjoyed the stuffing/gravy/sausage concoction.  I admit that I was jealous of her order.  I had the corned beef hash, which was ok.  Too much potato, not enough savory corned beef.  Great space and solid service.

Visiting Scottsdale from out of state and looked for a place for breakfast near our condo. Lived up to it's reviews. Great food, fast service, good prices. Loved their chorizo omelette and rosemary potatoes were fantastic. Not too much rosemary and just the right amount of garlic.
Outstanding meal!  I had the classic French toast combo with berries and it might have been the best French toast I have ever eaten.  The service was good as well.
Love this little place bar on one side great patio and the dining area. Like meeting my girlfriend's there for our happy hour breakfast

Saw this eatery on the Guy Fieri show . Was not disappointed at all ! Really quick service ( was right before lunch , breakfast was still being served ).  Chicken on the coup was incredible , couldn't stop eating it ! The pepper gravy was so savory , stuffing underneath was incredible !  Topped with over medium eggs , yummy
They have expanded and the food was not as good as the first time that we went.  They might have been having an off day...  Worth one more try.  If the food is the same we will cross it off our list.

Definitely recommended. Food was very good as was the service. Had the eggs with Brie and fig jam which was very good. My boys enjoyed the chocolate chip pancakes. Casual and comfortable. Right across from Westin. Prices slightly on high side but still a good value.

Yeah, this place is delicious - I orderd the Bahama Mama (marinated chicken with grilled pineapples and other good stuff). The chicken was moist and very flavorful. It was oozing with some special sauce that was Mmm Mmm Mmm. I didn't try the other items, but the people I was with ordered the potato pancakes, cameralized bananas (waffles and french toast) and a burger, and those items all looked delicious, too. They also raved about how tasty everything was.   The place was clean and the staff was friendly. :) I'd definitely make a 40 min drive just to eat here again. I want to try their breakfast foods!

Met my sister there for late breakfast, last weekend, and I ordered an omelet, Mediterranean - very delish, along with potatoes on the side.  My sister ordered a veggie omelet, also very good.  (I forget what her side dish was..)  Service is very good, and friendly wait-staff.  Maybe a little too friendly?  Our waiter touched my sister (shoulder, back..) a bit too much for our liking.  Maybe he is a *touchy-feely* type of guy, but it was a bit overdone.  Will I be back?  Most definitely - a good value for the money...

Great, quick takeout service for good breakfast burritos on a Saturday morning. The order is accurate. The food is quick. The service professional. Giving them 4 stars simply because we've never dined in and can't form a complete picture.

I've been a regular here since they opened. Today I tried the pancakes for the first time.  I am ruined forever, no pancakes will ever live up to these. These were the greatest pancakes I've ever eaten.  I'm actively fighting off my wife from eating my pancakes

We got there around 10:30 a.m. and the place was packed! I guess that's what happens when you get featured on The Food Network. We had to wait around 5 minutes (more or less) to get a seat. They had free wifi so it's aaaaall good. ;)  My husband ordered the french toast and coffee: Verdict: It's GOOD. The touch of cinnamon makes it sooo delicious. The coffee's average (he's a bit of a coffee nerd :p).  I got The Outlaw Scramble with ranch potatoes, toast, and homemade lemonade because it rhymes. Verdict: It has bacon, ham, sausage, and cheese topped with jalapeno sauce, so what's not to love?  The serving was too big for me so I shared it with my beloved other half who is more than willing to help me out - as always. He particularly liked the sausage bits.  I asked the friendly waiter why they call it "Perk" eatery and said it has something to do with the word "percolate". Too bad, I was hoping we share the same nickname.  Overall, we love this place! It's a good breakfast spot and we'll come back again for sure!

Breakfast places aren't abundant in 85254 land and this place is a welcome choice. Friendly staff and the chef even made rounds with the customers! The menu has the regular along with savory unusual. If you tired of McBreakfast and don't want rooty tooty then Perk is your place.

While staying  @ the Westin down the street and if you're looking for a yummy place for brunch or lunch this place is a total must eat at. We were there during the week so not much of a wait. Menu has many different choices or selections to choose from

Really nice place to stop and get a meal. You can tell the staff really cares about customers and want you to have a nice experience.  I've had meals here before especially lunch and have loved everything. They cook the meat nice and you can tell that the kitchen is clean and sanitary. Alleluia.

This is a locally owned breakfast spot run by people that obviously care. I tried the country-style corned beef hash, and I'm excited to go back and sample more of their unique dishes. I with they would dim the lighting a little.

Came here for brunch with the Fam bc of the good reviews and the fact it was featured on triple D on food network.  I got the porky pig sandwich, wife got the perk scramble and the kids got the 3 pancake plate.  My sandwich was pretty good, had pulled pork and chorizo with a flavorful chipotle sauce.  There was pork and chorizo in each bite, good proportions.  The Rosemary potatoes were good too but couldn't finish them bc the sandwich was so filling.  The kids enjoyed their pancakes/eggs/bacon, pretty standard.  The weakest dish honestly was the perk scramble.  The eggs were runny and just overall lacking in flavor.  The big knock for us was the price for each dish, each dish should have been like 3-5 dollars cheaper! The place was too over priced for the food we ordered.

Perk used to be our favorite Breakfast spot, but I feel the Dives/Diners spot went to their heads a bit.   The Owner/Mgr. has become rude and forgot who her early customers were. Food is still good, but now feel rushed the minute we sit down and the place has lost its personality.  Perk has now become our last choice for a morning out.
Nice breakfast menu, good and satisfying food. But the best part is the warm service; the make you feel special! The place is nice, clean and open.

First impression:  A gentleman and his wife were walking up and struggling with her pushing him in a wheel chair and the gentleman at the front rushed out and took over pushing him, getting them immediately to a table on a patio.   The staff is incredibly attentive and polite. The food was very good and reasonably priced for large portions. Breakfast tacos get an A.  We will definitely be coming back.

We went here today for the first time...We live a minute away, so we were excited to have finally went.  We also wanted this experience to be amazing... We arrived at 1:15pm on a Monday.  Lunch crowd was gone. We both liked the atmosphere, and the menu...Very excited to see some unique items on the menu.   A lady that walked in at the same time as we did, and sat right next to us, ordered and had her meal, before we were even asked for our order...Didn't care for that. When server finally came to take our order about 15 minutes in..it was clear that he did not want to be there or serve us, or both. We ordered the Turkey Ruben, I asked the young man serving us what the secret sauce on the menu was..he said just regular Ruben sauce and they serve it upon request.  I told him, that I'd like to try it. My boyfriend and I were sharing the meal and we told the server that.  We also ordered the greek salad. When the meal arrived, it was the sandwich on one plate, and the salad came out a bit later in one bowl.  He did ask if we needed anything else and we asked for two plates.  He asked if we wanted large or very small plates...smh He brought the plates and left.  The greek salad looked great...I mixed it all together and cut up the beets...Took a couple bites of the salad and realized that there was no dressing on it.  I tried getting the servers attention to no avail.. Back to the sandwich...Great Rye bread they use...really out of this world good.  There were two very thick slices of turkey on the bread, about a tablespoon of sauerkraut, maybe less.  The Ruben sauce was on the side and it was pretty decent. (not typical ruben sauce btw)  Finally got servers attention when we were done with sandwich (kinda wanted to have the salad WITH our sandwich)  I asked him for some dressing, he brought a cup of it..No apology for forgetting it, that was nice...I put it on the salad, took a few bites (was kind of over it )  It was ok...but we had to leave so we took the salad with us...It won't get eaten as we had dinner plans out...I hate wasting food, and throwing away money.  Btw,  Our waters were never refilled until he brought our bill when we were done.  Not a GREAT experience, however, having said that, we WANT the experience to be great, so we will give it one more try, as the food was decent..Service was not.

This is one of my favorite breakfast spots in N Scottsdale. It was featured on Triple D and I highly recommend any of the entrees that were featured on the show. I also like the "chicken of the coup" which consists of biscuits, gravy and eggs in a bowl. You also have to try their salsa! I have to buy a new bottle of it to take home every time we go for breakfast. Only side note- it's a little pricey for breakfast  ($10 - $15 per entree). Still worth the trip! ****4 Stars.
Great breakfast! Clean, classy atmosphere. A little slow service but very friendly staff.

Love this place. Open for breakfast and lunch... close at 2pm. Lots of Organic meals. Steak and eggs is best I've had ( 3 petite filets) cooked to perfection.Burgers are amazing.Very friendly and attentive.Now have a bar as well.

Ate here 3 days in a row because the food is so good! One of several DDD places that I've eaten and this one doesn't disappoint like so many others have.  Had the Mucho Smoocho, For Petes Steak, and The Gyro. All are highly recommended and none of those were the featured DDD items. Others in our party had those items and they were excellent!

One of our favorite breakfast places in all of Scottsdale and Phoenix.  The food is fresh, potions are large, and a lot of variety on the menu.   The servers are awesome and attentive.  My favorites are the Diners Drivein and Duve specials! Yummy!

Excellent burger. The service was very good. We sat outside, and the patio is right on the parking lot; not all that pleasant. We will definitely return for breakfast; excellent sounding menu. All in all a good place for breakfast or informal lunch.

I've eaten at this gem of a restaurant several times and I am so pleased that it is less than a mile from my house. The last time I ate there it was truly the best. I tried the Mediterranean omelet and it was so good I know I'll order it again and again. Service has always been top notch too!

This is one of our favorite places to go to for breakfast. It is very close to our house. We normally eat at the bar since it is usually busy and the bar moves quick. The food selection is good. I wish they had more gluten free items, but overall the food is delicious. Strongly recommend this place for breakfast. The team is always nice.

Stopped in for a late lunch after driving by and deciding to give the place a shot. It's on the end of a strip mall but the actual space inside is pretty cute. There's a bar area to the right and the rest has that diner feel.   Everyone who served us was really friendly and attentive. We were greeted and seated promptly, and someone checked in on us regularly throughout the meal. Waters were filled and we were asked if we needed a box: they were on top of it and seemed to really enjoy working there.   The menu has a page for breakfast and lunch, and you can imagine what items would appear on a classic diner menu. I went with the tuna melt and my girlfriend went with the burger. We both got fries as a side, and didn't have to wait long to receive our food.   It was good but nothing super special. I would probably go with breakfast if I ever came back, I think that side of the menu had some good variety. Definitely did the job of filling us up though and the prices were reasonable. If you are in the mood for a diner style meal this place will absolutely deliver.

Really top notch service and hospitality. The steak medallions were good. A bit more garlicky then I needed but nonetheless quite tasty. The restaurant feels very clean as were the restrooms. Totally Professional about customizing orders in any way. All fresh, all made to your order, all good!

After hearing rave reviews about Perk, I finally made it today. The place was packed yet  the wait was minimal. The waitress came promptly to our table to get our drink order...  People came in after us and were served before us...even though we had already ordered and their order was more complex than ours. Didn't like that...made me feel awkward.  The waitress kept referring to us as "you guys"...that really irritated me and got old really fast after she said it five times. I was in the company of a classy 77 year old lady friend and I dot feel it is appropriate to be addressed as such in a restaurant setting...a little too casual and tacky in my taste...  I had the breakfast sandwich and my friend had a pancake and both were very tasty.  While the food was good, I am dinging two stars for service for the items stated above. Call me harsh, I disagree as I do not judge a book by its cover but more by reading the whole experience...so I would say that maybe Perk is a little overrated. They are successful and good for them!...but I would not go out of my way to have breakfast there again.
Outstanding food and service!  One of my favorite breakfast spots in the whole valley.  Get the french toast!

I must admit I don't quite get Perk. I've eaten here several, actually many, times. I started as a curious DDD watcher, sharing the obligatory Wine Country French Toast. Pretty good. The favorite of our group on that first visit, however, was the rosemary breakfast potato. I was mystified, however, as to why DDD was drawn to this Scottsdale locale. Perhaps the crew wanted to stay at the Westin resort across the street.   I've returned over time with several different diners in tow, sampling pancakes... The potatoes were never again quite as good as I remembered, varying quite a bit visit to visit. Other items seemed Denny's-like. Never felt a welcoming vibe. I've lived in the Scottsdale/PV area for many years, so I'm used to "Snotsdale" attitude common in the area. Maybe they're just catering to DDD tourists. Hard to say.  On this day I dropped in by myself. Wanted to try their Belgian waffle, an item I'd never tried at Perk. Wanted a cup of coffee. Was seated and then waited. And waited. No coffee. No water. No welcome. That's the review I've been procrastinating about, I thought. I've been here often and still do not feel particularly welcome. At prime time. The hierarchy was all there. Not busy. I finally got up and left. No one said anything to me. Hmm. I drove down Greenway to the very non-Snotsdale Country Boys at 32nd Street. Only my second time there. They recognized me from a prior conversation, one unlike any I've ever had at Perk. They poured me coffee before I had time to open the menu. What a contrast. The 40th Street Café is another Greenway Road breakfast spot I'd recommend ahead of Perk.   Perk's food is at times interesting, perhaps more interesting than the other restaurants mentioned above, but the restaurant is missing the warmth and consistency you hope for in a neighborhood breakfast joint.

Tried this place out because of the reviews and also because they were on DDD and I gotta say I wasn't impressed. I started with a Bloody Mary which was pretty good. For my main meal I ordered the pancakes with eggs and sausage (and another Bloody Mary:) and to start off with I opted for an order of the biscuits and gravy - they should call it biscuit and gravy because we only got 1 biscuit.   Upon starting my third Bloody Mary I received my main meal and I could already tell the pancakes weren't gonna be amazing (you gotta know that I'm a pancake connoisseur, so I have high, but fair standards) and I was unfortunately correct. The pancakes were on the drier side and not fluffy at all. The sausage (which was highly recommended) had an odd taste and I did not enjoy it; the eggs were probably the best part, but you really can't screw that up.   On a lighter note, my wife enjoyed the breakfast enchiladas! They were so big you could split them with a second person.   All in all I wasn't a fan. I probably won't go back.

Tried this with my husband after church one Sunday. He had a burger and enjoyed it. I had a yogurt/fruit plate. I was disappointed.  It had a small cup of yogurt in the middle and a few blueberries, strawberries, cantelope around it. For $9. Not a deal. The next time I had the BLT and fries- they did them the way I like them- scorched hollow tubes- tortured- I want to hear them screaming from the kitchen. And they were. ;-)

This was my first time eating anything from Perk and I was definitely impressed. Got a carry out breakfast order: scrambled eggs with potatoes and a order of pancakes. The food was shared so I can actually talk about both. The eggs are fresh and fluffy, the potatoes were well season and a generous portion. As for the pancakes... Delicious! I will definitely be going back to check out more items. The thing that made me like this place was now friendly and welcoming everyone was. In the short time I was in there getting the order, I was greeted by probably 80% of the staff. Made me feel very welcome and even more likely to return.

Was happy to discover this great spot. The owners and staff are welcoming and give Perk a 'glad you're here' vibe. I have eaten there more than a dozen times (including take-out) and have taken friends and family. Not one complaint.  Thanks Perk.

I wanted to find a new place to eat, decided to try something out.  Between the 2 of us that ordered, I got the bahama mama and the lady got the sonoma omelet.    I stole some of her potatoes and they were awesome. Both items had swiss cheese and they definitely know what they are doing with it. Everything else just seemed like it was missing something.  Left my cup dry of water but that is generally because I drink way more than people expect.  I'd say try it out but, it has a good atmosphere, I just have other preferences for breakfast/sandwich type food.
Decided to check out this place since it appeared in guys dinners and dives... food is excellent, huevos rancheros and the French toast are a must try

I would really give Perk a 3.5 out of 5 stars. I used to rave about this place right when they first opened but my recent visit with my dad was only sub-par. The staff is friendly and accommodating. However, we were sat down first and then a couple arrived and was seated next to us about 5-10 minutes later and their order was taken before ours and they received their food way ahead of us too. That's just me being a little picky but I was very hungry and both of us were ready to order asap.   I ordered the Bahama Mama sandwich which is a unique dish on their menu as you can't find it anywhere else. It's very yummy, I love the combo of the pineapple and special cucumber sauce. My dad ordered to eggs any style with bacon and potatoes.   I just remember the food being much more appealing back when it first opened. Don't get me wrong, the sandwich was still good and the fries were very yummy but I wasn't totally WOW-ed.   I'm still going to head back on occasion when I'm in the area looking for breakfast!

Wow, cage free eggs? This could be pretty good right?   WRONG!   Do you have any idea how hard it is to cook eggs that are THIS BAD? Perk in Scottsdale makes it simple. First they take old eggs that were fried up yesterday and reheat them in the microwave, then, sparingly dump a few old and gross vegetable pieces inside and slather the eggs in dirty grease. Make sure to leave out any salt or spices and flavor to ensure a disgusting experience.   disgusting, greasy, flavorless, microwaved. I'm almost positive my health has been temporarily compromised by a simple omelette. I would be very embarrassed if this was my restaurant. Very, very sad, and I am entirely disgusted.   Next, these geniuses serve up a side of rosemary potatoes. This is hilarious... Large sprigs of greasy rosemary flopped on top of a pile of black potatoes. Its very clear that the owner of this restaurant just does not give a s*it.   Dear Gordon Ramsey, I have a new challenge for you. Perk Scottsdale. a disgusting mess and waste of $9 for an omelette.  Seriously. How do you f*ck up an omelette!? A Blind monkey could cook a better omelette while doing cartwheels on a space ship. Also, their plastic fork cut me. Everything just seems to be the poorest quality possible. I seriously couldn't make this stuff up.  If you're old and gross and don't care because you've completely let yourself go, this place is perfect for you, they care just as little as you do about how their food looks and tastes.  DISGUSTING! BEWARE!

First time visiting. Very good food and service. Very fast! We tried the chicken on the coup, potato pancakes, Belgium waffle, fries and omlete with rosemary potatoes. Everything was amazing but I'm definitely getting the chicken on the coup again!

I eat here  once every week or two. Service can be spotty but all you need to do is speak up!  My omelette of choice is the Mediterranean with egg whites. The cucumber dill sauce on top is lick your plate worthy. My husband loves the mambo omelette or the burrito supreme with red sauce (the green sauce is great too).  Peak eating hours expect a wait. Owners always speak to me about my meal. Love supporting small business! Give it a try.

A nice breakfast option we traveled too. The place was busy, but we waited 10 quick minutes. The menu is large with some grest egg entrees, and whimsical words in the descriptions. We enjoyed huevos rancheros, the gordo omelet, and loved the biscuits & gravy. Our server Nick was super friendly and always on point with coffee refills. Overall a nice breakfast eatery and would recommend to all.

I went here yesterday for lunch with my mom. This place is very close to her house and she, my brother, niece, and nephew frequent Perk for breakfast. So when we went in, someone (I think the owner?) greeted us and was wearing like a checkered hat and just seemed like a generally nice guy. We were seated in the small, but comfortable dining room. I ended up ordering the napa valley salad to split with my mom and a cup of chicken noodle soup and she got eggs and potatoes. The kitchen actually split the salad into two bowls, which was a really nice touch! The salad was Ah Maze Ing! Soooo good. It has a really creamy feta, wine soaked onions, walnuts, and apples on top of spinach with a creamy balsamic dressing. I could have licked the bowl, this salad was so good. The soup was also tasty, but nothing super special. My mom's rosemary potatoes were really good, with enough seasoning to give them a tasty flavor and her eggs were cooked perfectly. I will definitely come back here again and try one of their wonderful sounding breakfast items (yesterday they had pumpkin pancakes....yum! but in the name of being 'healthy' I skipped them yesterday, and instead ate a bunch of feta cheese (ha!)....*sigh). So go here! You won't be disappointed!

After reading the other yelp reviews, looking at pictures, and seeing that this place was featured on DDD, my expectations were high. Unfortunately, my experience did not come close to meeting those expectations.  To start, the tables were placed too close to each other, so we were uncomfortably close to other patrons. Second, the prices were over inflated. (Maybe they are capitalizing on DDD?) Lastly, once you do order the overpriced food it is VERY underwhelming in terms of taste, presentation, and most of all portion sizes. The picture of my girlfriend's breakfast sandwich says it all.  In conclusion, I don't recommend going to Perk Eatery. Prices are high, food is average, portions are small.

saw it on Triple D and since my husband works a couple of miles a way-we tried it.  what we had was good and the people were nice.  maybe we ordered the wrong items that would make it fit the 5 star category?  I wouldn't go out of my way to go there.

Decided to stop in to Perk Eatery on a Tuesday morning shortly before 8. About ¼ of the tables were filled. I was by myself. Seated and told that my waiter would be right with me. Look through the menu. Then I look around and there's lot's of Guy Fieri stuff there. They must have been on the DDD show. Ok, so now I've been there probably 7-8 minutes. Guy comes and cleans up the table next to me. I say "Good Morning." He says "Good Morning." Then he leaves. There appears to be some debate going on amongst the staff about who does what. Strange. I just want someone to bring me some coffee. So I wait and I wait and I wait. At 8:15 a group of 3 is seated adjacent to me and someone brings them coffee and takes their order. Seriously, even if you thought(mistakenly) that I was waiting for someone don't you think I might want something to drink. So I left without any fanfare. I was hungry but they won't get my business. Ever.

While I saw the Perk Eatery was showcased on Diners, Dives, and Drives Ins and since I was in AZ, I had to come check this place out.  First of all it is a cozy casual mom and pop restaurant and you will certainly find the owners working all aspects of the place.   The place has many small tables around the room, an outdoor seating area as well, and even a bar location. They basically have a good selection of beer, wine, and champagne. We went on a Saturday morning about 10:30 and it was not really busy for us.   I saw on the show an item called Wine Country French Toast and certainly had to have it. Let's just say it looked and tasted just as the TV show displaced (okay, you cant taste on TV, but you get the point)  They serve these Oregano potatoes and those are certainly a Must! A classic thing about this place is that serve only Breakfast and Lunch all day.  Also ordered the mimosa flutes which a basically pick 5 different flavors, they were great.  If I lived in the city, I would certainly be frequenting this place at least once a month and will definitely be back next time I visit Scottsdale!

Did not live up to the hype. Once again Guy Fieri has misled me. The wait was long on a Saturday AM, the food was average, and the Bloody Mary (although tasty) was overpriced. One visit was enough for me.

The food here is consistently great - I've had the breakfast burrito a few times and the corn beef hash last time. Large portions leaving you more than satisfied afterwards.  Service and atmosphere are so-so. Don't expect anything more than a casual breakfast with big portions of good, wholesome food.

It was OK... BUT...  they don't take American Express.  I realize this might sound picky... but it seemed strange that a restaurant (in a high tourist area) doesn't take AMEX - especially in this day and age.    Ok - moving on from that disappointment - the food was great.  I had a sandwich and my friend had a salad.  Both were very good and we thought nice value for the prices.  We also had GREAT coffee.  Beautifully prepared cap & latte.  The service was super friendly and accommodating.  The owner came over and chatted with us and was a really nice lady.   I love to support a local spot near my house and the food was great.  I would have given it 5 stars if they took AMEX...  I wouldn't take a crowd or have a business meeting there since I can't use my preferred credit card.  But I would go back for a quick bite with someone.
I try to eat here every time in town..... Had some great corned beef hash and poached eggs. As always, the food was great and the service was very good.

I came here once on a weekday on accident lol. I had a doctors appt a few feet away & was a lil hungover (tmi?) So I made my way over, thinking this was actually another food spot but realized too late. I was greeted as soon as I walked in and sat down right away. The service was good & my food was delicioso. It was a wonderful mistake, and the pricing was very reasonable. It's my new favorite spot!
The Brie turkey spinach fig compote omelet was a nice change of pace. Cool spot. Good, varied menu.

I met up with a friend in Scottsdale and he offered to take me out for breakfast. I'm always down for that so off we go. We were seated right away. I got the french toast with bacon, coffee and fresh squeezed OJ.   I was impressed by some of the small things. Real maple syrup for example and really good coffee. The bacon was thick cut and cooked just right. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was great. Not too noisy with just the right amount of low key conversation.   In short, it was terrific. I would go back in a heartbeat.
First time. Simple ham steak and eggs, over medium w/cottage cheese, wheat toast. Everything perfectly prepared; served hot...coffee superb! Pepe! Great service!

We were delight to see chorizo on the menu.  They had a varied menu with many breakfast options.  My daughter's had the run for the border platter and really enjoyed it.  I had a breakfast burrito with chorizo as did my son.  Everything came out quickly and the staff was pleasant.
One of my wifes and my favorite breakfast joints.  You have to try the cilantro jalapeno sauce.
Excellent breakfast. Extremely homey. Guy fireri approved. This place should have all the stars.

While staying at the Westin, we decided to have breakfast here since it was close.  The wait for our party of 5 was about 20 minutes.  When it was our turn, the hostess called our name and so we followed her into the restaurant (we had been waiting outside)...we stood at the front area while she told us to wait just a moment as they were getting our table ready.  As we stood there for a couple of minutes, another hostess came up and pretty much scolded us telling us that we needed to wait outside instead of blocking the register area while our table was getting cleared.  That was rude.   I ordered the fancy scramble which wasn't all that fancy.  They were scrambled eggs with a slice of brie and a dollop of fig splatted on top.  I could've done that myself at home.  My BIL ordered the huevos rancheros which he stated was pretty good.  The kids had the silver dollar pancakes which they devoured.  Unfortunately I can't remember what my hubs and SIL ordered - which means it must not have been that memorable.    Our server was pretty good though and she was attentive.  Coffee and waters were refilled promptly.  I probably would not come here again unless majority ruled.

Perk Eatery lives up the reviews and the hype.  We drove from downtown Scottsdale  passing many great places to give this a try and was well worth it. The building is nothing to rave about, its in a strip mall and is very diner, but that is part of the charm. Great diner food with a southwest twist. Not too heavy but still plenty of bite. The DDD Guy Fiery memorabilia is fun to see.

Not quite as delic as Guy made it out to be but the food really is very good !!! The palo sandwich was awesome !! ... The outlaw scramble didn't live up to expectations ... Too much cheap cheese with no taste!!  Service was very average ..... It was ok but slow and just not very friendly !!   Reason i give it only 2 stars is that they don't take amex!!! I mean come on guys ;) its 2015 !!! Its a restaurant and not a cheap one for that !!! Surely u can find a way to compensate for the extra 1% it costs to use amex over visa !!!  When i see a restaurant being cheap like that out front i get scared about what corners they cut in the back !!!    Not coming back sorry

Had pretty high expectations 1st time coming here, was not wowed by any one thing. The Steak and Eggs with Rosemary Potatoes were good. One of the better Breakfast Steaks that I have had, expected a flat dry slab of meat but had 3 thick small pieces that were very juicy and flavorful.   Was on the list of places to try and when I heard DDD had filmed there for a future show it pushed us to go.  A few of the breakfast places in San Diego have placed high standards for us which none of the AZ breakfast restaurants have been able to match.  Service was okay, was seated by an open door which felt tike a wind tunnel.

Love this place! Been coming here for 2 years and always get an amazing welcome from Pauline the owner and the amazing waitress Amanda. Food is awesome, love the service and ambiance. Totally recommend.
